info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud CX Sales - Catalog Product Groups
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Sales and Service â€” Catalog Product Groups module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Large Object (Lob) Attributes - File Web Image

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the product group denorm.

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Attachments resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Attachments. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Attachments collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Attachments to get the hash key.

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AttachedDocumentId; integer; The unique identifier of the attached document.
  • CategoryName; string; The category of the attachment.
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the attachment.
  • CreatedByUserName; string; The user name of the person who created the attachment.
  • CreationDate; string; The date and time when the attachment record was created.
  • DatatypeCode; string; The code associated with the data type.
  • DmDocumentId; string; The unique identifier of the document.
  • DmFolderPath; string; The path of attachment file.
  • DmVersionNumber; string; The version number of the document.
  • ExpirationDate; string; The expiration date of the contents in the attachment.
  • FileName; string; The name of the attachment file.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; The date when the attachment was last updated.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the attachment.
  • LastUpdatedByUserName; string; The user name of the person who last updated the attachment.
  • Uri; string; The URI of the attachment.
  • Url; string; The URL of the attachment.
  • UserName; string; The user name of the person who created the attachment.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds an attachment with the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • AttachedDocumentId; integer; The unique identifier of the attachments.

When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • Depth; integer; The difference between the level of the first and the last product group in the path.
  • FilterByTM; string; The filter by TM.
  • FirstProdGrpId; integer; The unique identifier of the first product group on the list.
  • InternalName; string; The internal name of the product group.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; The date and time when the product group was last updated.
  • ModelConfigAttributes; string; The configuration attributes of the product group.
  • ModelFamily; string; The name of the model family associated with the Product Group.
  • ModelLine; string; The name of the model line associated with the Product Group.
  • ModelName; string; The model name of the product group.
  • OverrideAllowSelectionYN; string; The override allow selection of the product group.
  • ParentProductGroupId; integer; The unique identifier of the parent product group for the penultimate node in the path.
  • PathId; integer; The unique identifier of the path.
  • ProdGrpDetailsId; integer; The unique identifier of the product group details.
  • ProductGroupDenormId; integer; The unique identifier of the product group denorm.
  • ProductGroupDescription; string; The translated product group description used for runtime display.
  • ProductGroupId; integer; The unique identifier of the product group.
  • ProductGroupName; string; The translated name of the product group used for runtime display.
  • ProductGroupReferenceNumber; string; The reference number of the product group.
  • ReferenceNumber; string; The reference number for integration with external systems.
  • RevenueCategoryCode; string; The revenue category code associated with the product group.
  • RevenueRoleCode; string; The revenue code associated with the product group.
  • UsageCode; string; The usage code associated with the product group.
  • UsageModeCode; string; The usage mode code associated with the product group.
  • UsageRootFlag; string; Indicates whether the group is a root group.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • GetParentProductGroups: Finds the parent product groups with the specified row finder.
    Finder Variables:
    • Bind_InventoryItemId; integer.
    • Bind_ProductGroupId; integer.
    • Bind_UsageCode; string; The product groups bind usage code.
    • Bind_UsageModeCode; string.
  • PrimaryKey: Find the product group by the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • ProdGrpDetailsId; integer.
    • ProductGroupDenormId; integer; The unique identifier of the catalog product group.

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key--- Language and ProdGroupId ---for the Translations resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Translations. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Translations collection resource with a filter on the primary key values in order to navigate to a specific instance of Translations.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the product group denorm.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • ISOLanguage; string; The ISO language associated with the product group like English or Danish.
  • ISOTerritory; string; The code associated with the ISO territory.
  • Language; string; The language in which the product group is translated.
  • LanguageCode; string; The language code associated with the product group like 639-1en (English) or 639-1da (Danish).
  • ProdGroupDescription; string; The translated description of the product group.
  • ProdGroupId; integer; The unique identifier of the product group.
  • ProdGroupName; string; The translated name of the product group.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc
